t: In*p the year that King Uzziah died I saw the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up; and the train of his robe filled the temple.
Above him stood the seraphim. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.
And one called to another and said: “Holy,*pn holy, holy is the Lord*s of hosts; the*ln whole earth is full of his glory!”
And*p the foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.
And I said: “Woe is me! For I am lost; for I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for my eyes have seen the King, the Lord*s of hosts!”
Then*p one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a burning coal that he had taken with tongs from the altar.
And he touched my mouth and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away, and your sin atoned for.”
And*p I heard the voice of the Lord saying, “Whom shall I send, and who will go for us?” Then I said, “Here I am! Send me.”
And he said, “Go, and say to this people: “‘Keep*pn on hearing, but do not understand; keep*ln on seeing, but do not perceive.’

Make*ln the heart of this people dull, and*ld their ears heavy, and*ld blind their eyes; lest*ln they see with their eyes, and*ld hear with their ears, and*ln understand with their hearts, and*ld turn and be healed.”
Then*ln I said, “How long, O Lord?” And*ln he said: “Until*ln cities lie waste without*ld inhabitant, and*ln houses without people, and*ld the land is a desolate waste,
and*ln the Lord*s removes people far away, and*ld the forsaken places are many in the midst of the land.
And*ln though a tenth remain in it, it*ld will be burned again, like*ln a terebinth or an oak, whose*ld stump remains when*ld it is felled.” The*ln holy seed is its stump.
